D313D775E1E54811941E175262CCBF12.description: The student will be able to value nonviolence by: discovering Christian teachings which speak about non-violence, locating scripture passages which illustrate healthy, non-violent relationships, describing various local and global situations of violence in whichever form (suggested topics: abuse, war), summarizing guidelines, based on their Christian traditions and scripture, for healthy, non-violent relationships

05F126BB5D074440B46A75828AD057D7.description: The student will be able to value justice and peace by: discovering Christian teachings which speak about justice and peace, locating scripture passages that speak of justice and peace,  finding local, national, and international examples of injustices which have led to disharmony (suggested topics: poverty, prejudice, under-/unemployment), reflecting on their, Christian traditions and scripture in order to propose solutions to these international injustices

FD90113DF8A84A5E914B2AB833AA3CB5.description: The student will be able to value reverence for all created life by: discovering:Christian teachings which speak about reverence for all created life, locating scripture passages that speak of reverence for life '., researching various issues about respect for life (suggested topics: suicide, ecology, euthanasia, applying scripture passages and their Christian traditions to various issues and proposing solutions

52DCD03A8E92493CB818ADA4F38FC74B.description: The student will be able to understand moral development by: discussing various theories of moral development, exploring the level of moral development,at which one may be operating

E993D4029E9341F59B1A9AB7620FBD88.description: The student will be able to understand key concepts in morality by: explaining morality's key concepts: freedom, law, principles, ends, means, authority, etc.

43B1875397184944B9FE756E582C1256.description: The student will be able to value personal and communal practices of faith by: examining scripture's guidelines to prayer, including "The Lord's Prayer" participating in various types of prayer used by Christians, examining the worship traditions of Christian Churches
